definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a card printed with words, numerals, or pictures to be used by an individual or a group as a basis for performing a specific activity.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a card printed with words, numerals, or pictures to be used by an individual or a group as a basis for performing a specific activity.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images. The cards are usually issued in sets.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a volume of maps or other cartographic content with or without descriptive text.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a volume of maps or other cartographic content with or without descriptive text.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a box containing bound or unbound resources.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a box containing bound or unbound resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a two-dimensional representation of data in graphic or tabular form.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a two-dimensional representation of data in graphic or tabular form.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a piece of metal stamped by government authority for use as money.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a piece of metal stamped by government authority for use as money.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a work in two dimensions or very low relief that was made by affixing paper, fabrics, photographs, or other materials onto a flat surface.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a work in two dimensions or very low relief that was made by affixing paper, fabrics, photographs, or other materials onto a flat surface.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of one of two or more vertical sections of text appearing on the same page or leaf.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of one of two or more vertical sections of text appearing on the same page or leaf.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a geographic representation of numeric data, or of the course or results of an action or process.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a geographic representation of numeric data, or of the course or results of an action or process.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources. The term is sometimes also applied to maps characterized by much simplified, or schematic, representation.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a three-dimensional representation of a scene created by placing objects, figures, etc., in front of a two-dimensional painted background.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a three-dimensional representation of a scene created by placing objects, figures, etc., in front of a two-dimensional painted background.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a visual work produced by drawing, which is the application of lines on a surface, often paper, by using a pencil, pen, chalk, or some other tracing instrument to focus on the delineation of form rather than the application of colour.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a visual work produced by drawing, which is the application of lines on a surface, often paper, by using a pencil, pen, chalk, or some other tracing instrument to focus on the delineation of form rather than the application of colour.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images. This term is often defined broadly to refer to computer-generated images as well.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of objects on display, along with the display environment of cases, labels, etc.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of objects on display, along with the display environment of cases, labels, etc.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a card, or digital representation of a card, carrying words, numerals, pictures, etc., designed for rapid display as an aid to learning.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a card, or digital representation of a card, carrying words, numerals, pictures, etc., designed for rapid display as an aid to learning.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a sheet designed to be read in pages when folded.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a sheet designed to be read in pages when folded.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a set of objects designed for manipulation according to prescribed or implicit rules for education, entertainment, or therapy.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a set of objects designed for manipulation according to prescribed or implicit rules for education, entertainment, or therapy.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a depiction of the earth or other celestial body, real or imaginary, on the surface of a sphere.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a depiction of the earth or other celestial body, real or imaginary, on the surface of a sphere.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of an image that portrays a sacred entity and that is itself regarded as sacred.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of an image that portrays a sacred entity and that is itself regarded as sacred.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images. Most commonly it comprises tempera on panel, but it may be in any two-dimensional or relief medium, including fresco.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a picture. usually on pasteboard or wood, which has been cut into interlocking shapes intended to be reassembled.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a picture, usually on pasteboard or wood, which has been cut into interlocking shapes intended to be reassembled.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a single bound or fastened sheet as a subunit of a volume; each leaf consists of two pages, one on each side, either or both of which may be blank.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a single bound or fastened sheet as a subunit of a volume; each leaf consists of two pages, one on each side, either or both of which may be blank.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a representation, normally to scale and on a two-dimensional medium, of a selection of material or abstract features on, or in relation to, the surface of the earth, another celestial body, or an imaginary place.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a representation, normally to scale and on a two-dimensional medium, of a selection of material or abstract features on, or in relation to, the surface of the earth, another celestial body, or an imaginary place.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a small piece of metal, bearing a relief design on one or both sides and having a commemorative purpose; not used as a medium of exchange.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a small piece of metal, bearing a relief design on one or both sides and having a commemorative purpose; not used as a medium of exchange.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a physical representation of a device or process that may be modified for training or analysis to emphasize a particular part or function.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a physical representation of a device or process that may be modified for training or analysis to emphasize a particular part or function.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a three-dimensional representation of a real or imagined object.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a three-dimensional representation of a real or imagined object.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources and three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a single side of a leaf.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a single side of a leaf.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of an item in which images are formed primarily by the direct application of pigment suspended in a medium, arranged in masses of colour onto a generally two-dimensional surface.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of an item in which images are formed primarily by the direct application of pigment suspended in a medium, arranged in masses of colour onto a generally two-dimensional surface.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of an image captured by a lens and carried on the surface of a sheet.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of an image captured by a lens and carried on the surface of a sheet.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of two-dimensional representations.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of two-dimensional representations.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a container for holding loose materials, that usually consists of two covers joined together at the back.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a container for holding loose materials, that usually consists of two covers joined together at the back.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a card on which a message may be written or printed for mailing without an envelope.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a card on which a message may be written or printed for mailing without an envelope.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a notice, usually decorative or pictorial, intended to be posted to advertise, promote, or publicize an activity, cause, product, or service; also, a decorative, mass-produced print intended for hanging.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a notice, usually decorative or pictorial, intended to be posted to advertise, promote, or publicize an activity, cause, product, or service; also, a decorative, mass-produced print intended for hanging.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a pictorial work produced by transferring an image by means of a matrix such as a plate, block, or screen, using any of various printing processes.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a pictorial work produced by transferring an image by means of a matrix such as a plate, block, or screen, using any of various printing processes.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a scale representation of the intersection of a vertical surface, which may or may not be a plane, with the surface of the ground, or of the intersection of such a vertical surface with that of a conceptual three-dimensional model representing phenomena having a continuous distribution.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a scale representation of the intersection of a vertical surface, which may or may not be a plane, with the surface of the ground, or of the intersection of such a vertical surface with that of a conceptual three-dimensional model representing phenomena having a continuous distribution.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a photograph produced by the passage of radiation, such as X rays, gamma rays, or neutrons, through an opaque object.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a photograph produced by the passage of radiation, such as X rays, gamma rays, or neutrons, through an opaque object.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a pictorial product of any remote-sensing instrument that detects and measures reflected and/or emitted electromagnetic radiation from a distance and reflected underwater sound waves in the case of sonar.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a pictorial product of any remote-sensing instrument that detects and measures reflected and/or emitted electromagnetic radiation from a distance and reflected underwater sound waves in the case of sonar.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a physical representation, usually of art, in which an image or form is produced in relief, in intaglio, or in the round.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a physical representation, usually of art, in which an image or form is produced in relief, in intaglio, or in the round.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a scale representation of a vertical surface, commonly a plane, displaying both the profile where it intersects the surface of a celestial body, or some conceptual model, and the underlying structures along the plane of intersection.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a scale representation of a vertical surface, commonly a plane, displaying both the profile where it intersects the surface of a celestial body, or some conceptual model, and the underlying structures along the plane of intersection.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of an individual unit or sample chosen to represent a larger population or aggregation.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of an individual unit or sample chosen to represent a larger population or aggregation.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of an image sometimes accompanied by text and used for education.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of an image sometimes accompanied by text and used for education.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a cross section, detail, diagram, elevation, perspective, plan, working plan, etc., made for use in an engineering or other technical context.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a cross section, detail, diagram, elevation, perspective, plan, working plan, etc., made for use in an engineering or other technical context.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of an object designed for education, entertainment, or stimulation through play.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of an object designed for education, entertainment, or stimulation through play.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to three-dimensional forms.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that is a perspective representation of the landscape in which detail is shown as if projected on an oblique plane.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that is a perspective representation of the landscape in which detail is shown as if projected on an oblique plane.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to cartographic resources. A birdÔÇÖs-eye view, panorama, panoramic drawing, wormÔÇÖs-eye view, etc., are included.

definition[0]_en: A unit of extent that consists of a tabular or graphic representation of data appropriate for display on a wall.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A unit of extent that consists of a tabular or graphic representation of data appropriate for display on a wall.
scope note[0]_en: This term applies to still images.
